Tags Interface¶

class epyk.interfaces.components.CompTags.Tags(context)¶
a(text, url, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <a> tag defines a hyperlink, which is used to link from one page to another.

The most important attribute of the <a> element is the href attribute, which indicates the link’s destination.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_a.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • url – String. Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

abbr(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <abbr> tag defines an abbreviation or an acronym, like “HTML”, “Mr.”, “Dec.”, “ASAP”, “ATM”.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_abbr.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

b(text, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <b> tag specifies bold text without any extra importance.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_b.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

bdi(text, width=100, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

BDI stands for Bi-Directional Isolation. The <bdi> tag is new in HTML5.

Usage:

bdi = rptObj.ui.tags.bdi("bdi tag")

bdi.click(rptObj.js.alert(“test”)) bdi.css({‘cursor’: ‘pointer’})

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_bdi.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

bdo(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

bdo stands for Bi-Directional Override. The <bdo> tag is used to override the current text direction.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_bdo.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

cite(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <cite> tag defines the title of a work (e.g. a book, a song, a movie, a TV show, a painting, a sculpture, etc.).

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_cite.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

Add an HTML comment to the code

Parameters

text – String with the content to be added to the component

em(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <em> tag is a phrase tag. It renders as emphasized text.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_em.asp

h1(text, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <h1> to <h6> tags are used to define HTML headings.

<h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_hn.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

i(text, width=None, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <i> tag defines a part of text in an alternate voice or mood. The content of the <i> tag is usually displayed in italic.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_i.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

ins(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <ins> tag defines a text that has been inserted into a document.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_ins.asp

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

kbd(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <kbd> tag is a phrase tag. It defines keyboard input.

mark(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <mark> tag defines marked text.

Use the <mark> tag if you want to highlight parts of your text.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_mark.asp

meter(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <meter> tag defines a scalar measurement within a known range, or a fractional value. This is also known as a gauge.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_meter.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

p(text, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

A paragraph is marked up as follows with the <p> tag: <p>This is some text in a paragraph.</p>

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_p.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

q(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <q> tag defines a short quotation.

Browsers normally insert quotation marks around the quotation.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_q.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

s(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <s> tag specifies text that is no longer correct, accurate or relevant.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_s.asp

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

samp(text, size=None, 'px', width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <samp> tag is a phrase tag. It defines sample output from a computer program.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_samp.asp

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

small(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

strong(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <strong> tag is a phrase tag. It defines important text.

sub(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <sub> tag defines subscript text. Subscript text appears half a character below the normal line, and is sometimes rendered in a smaller font. Subscript text can be used for chemical formulas, like H2O.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_sub.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

sup(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <sup> tag defines superscript text. Superscript text appears half a character above the normal line, and is sometimes rendered in a smaller font. Superscript text can be used for footnotes, like WWW

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_sup.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

time(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <time> tag defines a human-readable date/time.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_time.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

u(text, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

Underline a misspelled word with the <u> tag: <p>This is a <u>paragraph</u>.</p>

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_u.asp

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component

wbr(text, width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip='', options=None, profile=None)¶

The <wbr> (Word Break Opportunity) tag specifies where in a text it would be ok to add a line-break.

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_wbr.asp

Parameters

  • text – String with the content to be added to the component

  • width – Tuple with the width value and its unit

  • height – Tuple with the height value and its unit

  • htmlCode – String. The code reference of the component

  • tooltip – String. The tooltip to be display on the component

  • profile – Boolean flag to set the profiling mode for the component
